Detailed Description

The class to provide base facility to access RawContacts table.

The following example demonstrates how to use this RawContacts class.

 getColumn(){
     String id      = RawContacts::_ID();
     String rawContactsId = RawContacts::CONTACT_ID();
 }

Definition at line 25 of file RawContacts.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::content::RawContacts::RawContacts ( const RawContacts &  o) [private]

Member Function Documentation

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::_ID ( ) [static]

Row ID.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::ACCOUNT_NAME ( ) [static]

The name of the account instance to which this row belongs, which when paired with ACCOUNT_TYPE identifies a specific account.

For example, this will be the Gmail address if it is a Google account. It should be set at the time the raw contact is inserted and never changed afterwards.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::ACCOUNT_TYPE ( ) [static]

The type of account to which this row belongs, which when paired with ACCOUNT_NAME identifies a specific account.

It should be set at the time the raw contact is inserted and never changed afterwards.

To ensure uniqueness, new account types should be chosen according to the Java package naming convention. Thus a Google account is of type "com.google".

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::AGGREGATION_MODE ( ) [static]

A mechanism that allows programmatic control of the aggregation process.

The allowed values are AGGREGATION_MODE_DEFAULT, AGGREGATION_MODE_DISABLED and AGGREGATION_MODE_SUSPENDED.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::CONTACT_ID ( ) [static]

The ID of the row in the Contacts table that this raw contact belongs to.

Contacts are linked to Contacts by the aggregation process, which can be controlled by the AGGREGATION_MODE field.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::CUSTOM_RINGTONE ( ) [static]

A custom ringtone associated with a raw contact.

Typically this is the URI returned by an activity launched with the ACTION_RINGTONE_PICKER intent. To have an effect on the corresponding value of the aggregate contact, this field should be set at the time the raw contact is inserted. To set a custom ringtone on a contact, use the field Contact.CUSTOM_RINGTONE instead.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::DATA_SET ( ) [static]

The data set within the account that this row belongs to.

This allows multiple sync adapters for the same account type to distinguish between each others' data. The combination of ACCOUNT_TYPE, ACCOUNT_NAME, and DATA_SET identifies a set of data that is associated with a single sync adapter.

This is empty by default, and is completely optional. It only needs to be populated if multiple sync adapters are entering distinct data for the same account type and account name.

It should be set at the time the raw contact is inserted and never changed afterwards.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::DELETED ( ) [static]

The "deleted" flag: "0" by default, "1" if the row has been marked for deletion.

When delete(Uri, String, StringArray()) is called on a raw contact, it is marked for deletion and removed from its aggregate contact. The sync adaptor deletes the raw contact on the server and then calls ContactResolver.delete once more, this time passing the CALLER_IS_SYNCADAPTER query parameter to finalize the data removal.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::DIRTY ( ) [static]

Flag indicating that VERSION has changed, and this row needs to be synchronized by its owning account.

Type: INTEGER (boolean)

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::DISPLAY_NAME_ALTERNATIVE ( ) [static]

An alternative representation of the display name, such as "family name first" instead of "given name first" for Western names.

If an alternative is not available, the values should be the same as DISPLAY_NAME_PRIMARY.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::DISPLAY_NAME_PRIMARY ( ) [static]

The standard text shown as the contact's display name, based on the best available information for the contact (for example, it might be the email address if the name is not available).

The information actually used to compute the name is stored in DISPLAY_NAME_SOURCE.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::DISPLAY_NAME_SOURCE ( ) [static]

The kind of data that is used as the display name for the contact, such as structured name or email address.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::LAST_TIME_CONTACTED ( ) [static]

The timestamp of the last time the contact was contacted.

To have an effect on the corresponding value of the aggregate contact, this field should be set at the time the raw contact is inserted. After that, this value is typically updated via markAsContacted(ContentResolver, long).

RawContacts& gaia::content::RawContacts::operator= ( const RawContacts &  o) [private]
static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::SEND_TO_VOICEMAIL ( ) [static]

An indicator of whether calls from this raw contact should be forwarded directly to voice mail ('1') or not ('0').

To have an effect on the corresponding value of the aggregate contact, this field should be set at the time the raw contact is inserted.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::SORT_KEY_ALTERNATIVE ( ) [static]

Sort key based on the alternative representation of the full name.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::SORT_KEY_PRIMARY ( ) [static]

Sort key that takes into account locale-based traditions for sorting names in address books.

The default sort key is DISPLAY_NAME_PRIMARY.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::SOURCE_ID ( ) [static]

String that uniquely identifies this row to its source account.

Typically it is set at the time the raw contact is inserted and never changed afterwards. The one notable exception is a new contacts: it will have an account name and type (and possibly a data set), but no source id. This indicates to the sync adapter that a new contact needs to be created server-side and its ID stored in the corresponding SOURCE_ID field on the phone.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::STARRED ( ) [static]

An indicator for favorite contacts: '1' if favorite, '0' otherwise.

Changing this field immediately affects the corresponding aggregate contact: if any raw contacts in that aggregate contact are starred, then the contact itself is marked as starred.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::SYNC1 ( ) [static]

Generic column for use by sync adapters.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::SYNC2 ( ) [static]

Generic column for use by sync adapters.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::SYNC3 ( ) [static]

Generic column for use by sync adapters.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::SYNC4 ( ) [static]

Generic column for use by sync adapters.

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::TIMES_CONTACTED ( ) [static]

The number of times the contact has been contacted.

To have an effect on the corresponding value of the aggregate contact, this field should be set at the time the raw contact is inserted. After that, this value is typically updated via markAsContacted(ContentResolver, long).

static const gaia::base::String gaia::content::RawContacts::VERSION ( ) [static]

Version number that is updated whenever this row or its related data changes.

This field can be used for optimistic locking of a raw contact.

Member Data Documentation

const int gaia::content::RawContacts::AGGREGATION_MODE_DEFAULT [static]

Aggregation mode: aggregate immediately after insert or update operation(s) are complete.
